column4: From another machine on the network (dsl not ubuntu) how do i connect to the X login on my ubuntu box (which does allow remote logins by my configuration)
you need a client to login over network.... if its not built in, you'll have to find one and compile it
hmm, what kind of "client"?
a login client....
yea, but such as? :)
no idea - both gnome and kde have one built-in, but....
not very scary
ext2ntfs 0.5 is a great driver, if you can get it setup
does it support ext3 journals?
No, it just ignores the journal
and I'm still trying to find a proper xfs driver
which is harmless, really
if it writes and ignores the journal?
harmless, the journal is only for fs ops that arent fully completed
so if you crash while writing?
then you're gonna have to fsck, same as before the journal came around
it works exactly how ext2 worked
but will it be marked as dirty?
that's debatable, personally any time i allowed a non kernel driver to write to my ext{2,3} fs, i'd force a fsck
the drivers simply arent very mature yet
and the drivers for xfs and reiser are non-existant....
i gotta run, but i'll be back in a few hours if you care to continue this discussion
yeup
ext2/ext3's safest bet, but.. ymmv
